column4: why does cat /proc/cpuinfo report 2.6ghz under load even though my cpu is overclocked to 3.2ghz?
how are you oc'ing it?
fsb increase, it shows 3.2ghz under both bios and cpu-z under windows
perhaps.  i'm not sure what that value reads tbh.
well, my cpu can't even be set to 2.6ghz under the current fsb
what is the chip clocked at from the factory?
2.6ghz, so I guess it's reading hardware strings rather than actual clock speed
dmesg says [    0.000000] Detected 3218.389 MHz processor.
there you go.
then [    1.195928] powernow-k8:    0 : pstate 0 (2600 MHz)
but it has no gpu acceleration?
what.
qt and gnome have never really played well together.  just like kde and gtk+.  they work, but not perfectly.
i explained it but you rudely "closed the page"
apologies, freenode webchat + firefox doesn't seem to be reliable
qt and gnome have never really played well together.  just like kde and gtk+.  they work, but not perfectly.  and no worries.
ic, so gtk apps wouldn't use those balloons?

uhm... sure?  i'm not sure.  i just know they've never historically played well together.  they're always getting better...
